meanings.sent1: The muddy shoes were defiling the freshly cleaned floor.
meanings.sent2: The spilled ink was defiling the white paper.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was defiling the garden with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist defiled the blank wall with spray paint.
meanings.sent5: The pollution was slowly defiling the once crystal-clear river.

meanings.sent1: The villain's plan was to defile the princess's innocence.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer sought to defile the purity of the sacred temple.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp tried to defile the fairy's magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic attempted to defile the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch's curse aimed to defile the prince's honor.

meanings.sent1: The vandals were defiling the ancient tomb with their graffiti.
meanings.sent2: The disrespectful act defiled the sanctity of the church.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's actions seemed to defile the seriousness of the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The sacrilegious act defiled the sacred altar.
meanings.sent5: The disrespectful behavior defiled the solemnity of the ritual.
